default: Select a dataset from the dropdown above, then mouse over any state to highlight and view data values.
manufacturing_output: Total manufacturing output in $Billions, 2016. Source: National Association of Manufacturers
unemployment_rate: Unemployment rate as a percentage of the labor force and defined by place of residence, March 2018. Source: Bureau of Labor Statistics
agriculture_dollars: Cash receipts by commodity, 2016. Source: USDA Economic Research Service
median_age: Median age from U.S. Census Data, 2014. Source: The Denver Post
incarceration_rate: Rate per 100,000 people of all ages, 2013. Source: Wikipedia
graduation_rate: Share of high school students that graduate within 4 years. Source: EdWeek
overdose_deaths: Number of age adjusted deaths per 100,000 in the population. Source: Centers for Disease Prevention
obesity_rate: Self reported obesity, 2016. Source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
poverty_rate: Adjusted for cost of living, 2014. Source: Wikipedia
religion: Percentage of adults stating that religion is 'very important' or 'somewhat important' in 2014. Source: Pew Research Center
internet_use: Internet usage among ages 3+ in any location, July 2015. Note: these figures have a 2-3 percentage point +/-. Source: NTIA
